title: West Bromwich
summary: West Bromwich (/ˈbrɒmɪtʃ/ (listen) BROM-itch) is a market town in the borough of Sandwell, West Midlands, England. Historically part of Staffordshire, it is 6.4 miles (10.3 km) northwest of Birmingham. West Bromwich is part of the area known as the Black Country, in terms of geography, culture, and dialect.[3] West Bromwich had a population of almost 78,000 in 2018.[4][2]
